title: Comparative Study of Individual vs. Sequential Skill Practice Pedagogies for Manual Therapy Skill Acquisition

context.prior_knowledge: Basic anatomy, physiology, and physical therapy theory
context.additional_context: Teaching competency enhancement course for pre-service or in-service teachers, featuring VR simulator-based practical environments and self-directed learning via personal devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Students can independently perform specific manual therapy techniques with 80% accuracy through isolated skill practice
Students achieve 70% proficiency in integrating 3–4 related manual therapy techniques through continuous skill practice
Students can analyze cognitive load differences between two teaching methods and select strategies aligned with their learning styles
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
